Package core

Class ReachabilityGraph

java.lang.Object
core.ReachabilityGraph
public class ReachabilityGraph extends Object

Class representing a reachability graph.

A reachability graph basically consists of the states a petrinet can be in and edges between those states being represented by transitions being fired. While the graph itself is being represented by the net of PetrinetStates this class holds information about the current state, current edge, validity of the petrinet (concerning its boundedness) and methods for adding and removing states. Additionally it provides a ReachabilityStateChangedListener communicating changes to the graph and a ReachabilityGraphUndoQueue recording steps. Changes can be stopped to be pushed on the queue or marked as skippable.

    • setSkippableMode

      public void setSkippableMode(boolean skippableMode)
      If set true all changes made to the reachability graph are flagged as skippable an will be skipped when re-/undoing changes. False by default.
      Parameters:
      skippableMode - if true, added steps are flagged skippable in the undo queue

    • setPushing

      public void setPushing(boolean pushing)
      When set to true all changes are pushed onto the undo queue. True by default.
      Parameters:
      pushing - if true, changes will be pushed to the undo queue
